intro: Tylophora hispida var. balansae, commonly known as the hairy tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
